clinical_study.brief_title: Construction and Evaluation of the Liquid Biopsy-based Early Diagnostic Model for Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Construction and Evaluation of the Liquid Biopsy-based Early Diagnostic Model for Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to detetct Circulating tumor cells(CTCs) and Cancer Associated Macrophage-Like cells (CAMLs) in patients with pulmonary nodules using a novel microfluidic CTC-detection system. Then construct an early diagnostic model for lung cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients found pulmonary nodules by CT screening will be enrolled in this study prospectively. CTCs and CAMLs both are cancer specific biomarkers found in the peripheral blood of patients with solid tumors including lung cancer. Through detecting CTCs and CAMLs in healthy volunteers and patients with pulmonary nodules who undergo biopsy, determine the cut-off value of the test. Further analysis of the test specificity and sensitivity, and on this basis construct an early diagnostic model for lung cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of prevalence of CTCs and CAMLs in patients with pulmonary nodules
primary_outcome.description: The number of CTCs and CAMLs will be detected in the peripheral blood of patients with pulmonary nodules using a novel microfluidic CTC-detection system.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of optimal cut-off values for screening Lung Cancer paitents
secondary_outcome.description: The optimal cut-off values will be determined by the ROC analyses.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects with pulmonary nodules diagnosed by chest CT or low-dose computed tomography (LDCT) scans

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female or male, 18 years of age or older
- Pulmonary nodules diagnosed by chest CT or low-dose computed tomography (LDCT) scans
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior diagnosis of lung cancer or other invasive malignancy within the past 5 years
